Race.SpecificTitle: City Marshal -- City Court, City of Ville Platte
Road District No.4 -- 15 Mills - Police Jury - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road District No. 4 Proposition

Summary:  Authority to extend and continue to levy a 15 mills property tax for a period of 20 years beginning with the year 2009 for the purpose of constructing and improving Parish roads and highways within the District, or for the maintenance thereof, said tax to be in lieu of and replace a tax of 15 mills now authorized to be levied through the year 2016 pursuant to an election held in the District on November 7, 2006.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. 4 of the Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to extend and continue to levy a fifteen (15) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $201,915) on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of twenty (20) years beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of constructing and improving Parish roads and highways within the District, or for the maintenance thereof, said tax to be in lieu of and replace a tax of 15 mills now authorized to be levied through the year 2016 pursuant to an election held in the District on November 7, 2006?

Race.SpecificTitle: Wd.One Wd.Wide Sch.Dist. -- $17,750,000 Bond - SB - 30 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Ward One Wardwide School District Bond Proposition

Summary:  Authority to issue not exceeding $17,750,000 of general obligation bonds for a term not exceeding 30 years, with the proceeds of the bonds to be used for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the district, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, as described and set forth in Plan B approved by the School Board on August 20, 2008, said bonds to be payable primarily from ad valorem taxes and may be additionally payable from the levy and collection of any sales and use tax hereafter approved by the voters of the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Ward One Wardwide School District of the Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Seventeen Million Seven Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars ($17,750,000), to be issued in series from time to time, to run not exceeding thirty (30) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, as described and set forth in Plan B approved by the School Board on August 20, 2008, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District, and will be payable primarily from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto and may be additionally payable from the levy and collection of any sales and use tax hereafter approved by the voters of the District?
